name: Thomas Begin
content: Thomas Begin's home page Thomas Begin I am a Professor at Université Claude Bernard Lyon 1, and a member of the LIP lab. I am the scientific head of the Hownet team (before I was a member of the Dante team). I am the deputy director of the Computer Science department of Univ. Lyon 1. I received the ACM MSWiM'20 Rising Star Award. My research is in the area of performance evaluation as applied to computer networks and systems. I am particularly interested in applying queueing theory, stochastic modeling, and machine learning techniques to practical problems in order to better understand and configure existing systems. Active topics of interests include: Wireless local area networks; Cloud Computing; Internet of Things; Multi-server queues. Together with Alexandre Brandwajn, we deployed a web application that produces the solution of certain queueing systems using our research material (e.g., G/M/c-like, M/G/1-like, and M/G/c-like queues). Click here to access the tool. Together with Alexandre Brandwajn, we authored a textbook on the performance modeling of computer systems. It covers techniques, principles, and applications, focusing on approximation methods and recent multi-server model advancements. Click here to access the book. News Our submitted ANR project NEMIoT with Orange, and Polytechnique Paris has been funded for 3 years by ANR! Starting in January 2024. I have a Master internship proposal on low-consuption Wi-Fi for IoT. Contact me for more information. During the 2015-2016 academic year, I was on research leave at DIVA lab - University of Ottawa (uOttawa) - Canada. This leave was funded through a CNRS grant.
